intro: Narcissus poeticus var. albus, commonly known as the white daffodil, is a striking member of the Amaryllidaceae family. It is characterized by its elegant, trumpet-shaped flowers that are predominantly white with a yellow throat. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring strap-like, grassy leaves. Native to southern Europe, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. This variety is prized for its simplicity and is often cultivated in gardens for its early spring bloom.
